channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish bags dunped near bin, 20th June
item.description:
A large amount of domestic and business rubbish bags dumped neat to bin on Glensworth Street junction with Melcombe Street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glentworth Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheelie bins overflowing with rubbish, 20th June
item.description:
There are wheelie bins in the alley between the corner shop and no.33 which are private but are constantly used as public bins. The rubbish is overflowing and thanks to the heat it now stinks of rotting refuse and is attracting flies and rats.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Domestic Waste left on the street, 20th June
item.description:
The domestic rubbish has been left on the pavement for over 10 days and includes food, dirty nappies. I have spotted a rat hanging around and its now starting to smell really foul. Tis is a hazard to0 the public.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Craigerne Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds getting out of control on the payment, 20th June
item.description:
Weeds around the whole Stapleton Road, Chessington Avenue area getting out of control. Potential damage to the pavements, rubbish getting caught up in them etc. I can’t remember the last time I saw someone come round to spray weed killer to keep this under control. Why, when the grass is cut in this area, isn’t this done at the same time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stapleton Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet
